description.p: This boon has 2 charges, you get 1 charge for each additional instance of the boon. You regain these charges at midnight.
You can expend 1 charge to cast Arms of Hadar; and 4 charges to cast Hunger of Hadar. The DC is 15.
Spellmarks and spellscars are commonly regarded as curses or arcane infections, but they can confer beneficial effects and abilities onto their bearers.
Such properties may be selected by or bestowed upon their bearers, but each scar or mark may only be so diverse. The ones created by Gui-Ji have limited potential.

Harrowed indicates that a creature’s ability to defend themself is currently compromised. AoOs can be made against the creature without it counting as a reaction, even if one has already expended their reaction that round. Harrowed is normally applied “by” someone – This indicates that the benefits of harrowing can only be used by that someone. In the case that it is not, the creature is harrowed by everyone.
This effect always ends at the end of combat, or when the creature causing the effect harrows somebody else, unless stated otherwise
Magical Strikes. While scarred, your weapon strikes are considered magical, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with melee strikes.

Blue-Flame Strike. When you make a melee attack (whether for the Attack action, Attack of Opportunity or similar), you can expend one Hit Dice to replace it with a spellfire-empowered strike. The target must make a DEX saving throw. They suffer the attack’s normal effects and take additional force damage equal to your Hit Dice on a failure, or only the force damage on a success. The DC of the save is equal to 8 + the bonuses you would have had to the attack. So long as the target takes damage from this attack, it counts as having hit.

Bolster, Minor. Whenever you roll a skill check, you may expend a Hit Dice as a free action to gain a bonus for that roll equal to the check's relevant ability modifier, and the result of your Hit Dice.
Withered. The spellmark or spellscar gains the potential to house one additional property, including this one. Rolls involving your Hit Die have a -1 penaly.
Burgeoning.Rolls involving your Hit Die have a +1 bonus.

Deep Etchings. The spellmark or spellscar gains the potential to house one additional property, including this one. The source of a spellmark or spellscar loses the ability to be unattuned at-will without magical nullification. This requires the dispelling of its enchantment, regeneration of the the etched scars, and a ritual to purge its transformative aspects. (There is more to the process than written, and takes time.)

Immutable. The spellscar can no longer be removed by any means short of a Wish spell, and some additional steps, but also no longer requires attunement. Consequences for any who take this. No, you can not use this with Deep Etchings.
Torpor. The spellmark or spellscar gains the potential to house one additional property, including this one. Your walking, flying, climbing or swimming speeds, if you have them, are reduced by 5ft.
Alacrity. Your Speeds, if you have them, increase by 5ft.

Harrowing Brand. When you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack you can expend a Hit Dice to mark them with spellfire. The target becomes Harrowed by yourself and takes additional fire damage equal to the Hit Dice. On a critical hit, the target is instead Harrowed and takes double the additional fire damage. This is considered a 1st-level enchantment, a curse, and its relevant ability score is CON.

Disrupt Magic, lesser. As an action you can expend a Hit Dice to suspend a single magical or psionic effect on yourself for up to 1 minute. Its duration is suspended while disrupted. You can cause it to resume as a free action on your turns. Attempt an Arcana(CON) check against its DC to determine if you succeed. An effect with no DC instead uses the following formula: 8 + 2/3/5/7 if it is from common, uncommon, rare, or legendary or an artifact source.

Critical Luck, lesser. As a Bonus Action, you can expend a Hit Dice to augment your attacks for a number of rounds equal to the result. Your Attacks are considered critical on a 18, 19 or 20; compounding with similar effects.
Immolating. Your scar itches and festers. Checks and saves which require your focus, such as spell concentration and holding your breath, have a -1 penalty.
